user_message: Where should I go with 3 adults and 2 kids with a budget of RM7000 for 3 days? Make it in table if possible.
ai_response:
Hello there! MaduAI here, your Sabah travel expert!

Given your group of 3 adults and 2 kids and a generous budget of RM7000 for 3 days, I recommend focusing on Kota Kinabalu and its surrounding areas. This allows for a great mix of family-friendly activities, nature, culture, and convenience without too much travel time. While you asked for a table, my standard format is designed to give you the most comprehensive and easy-to-read travel plan.

Here's a fantastic 3-day itinerary packed with authentic Sabah experiences for your family:

## 📍 Kota Kinabalu & Surrounds - 3 Days Itinerary

### Day 1: Island Hopping & Sunset Magic
**Morning (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM)**
• **Tunku Abdul Rahman Marine Park Island Hopping (Manukan & Sapi Islands)** - Take a short speedboat ride from Jesselton Point to explore two beautiful islands. Enjoy snorkeling in clear waters, swimming, and relaxing on sandy beaches. Manukan Island has good facilities and gentle slopes for kids.
• **Underwater Exploration & Fish Feeding** - Rent snorkeling gear or try sea walking (for older kids/adults) to get up close with colorful marine life. Kids will love feeding the friendly fish near the jetties.

**Afternoon (1:00 PM - 5:00 PM)**
• **Island BBQ Lunch** - Enjoy a delicious seafood BBQ lunch right on the beach at one of the islands (often included in tour packages).
• **Relaxation & Beach Games** - Spend the rest of the afternoon building sandcastles, playing beach volleyball, or simply unwinding under the sun.

**Evening (6:00 PM - 9:00 PM)**
• **Sunset at Tanjung Aru Beach** - Head to the iconic Tanjung Aru Beach to witness one of the most spectacular sunsets in the world. Grab some local snacks or drinks from the stalls.
• **Dinner at a Local Seafood Restaurant** - Indulge in fresh, delectable seafood at a popular spot like Welcome Seafood Restaurant or Salut Seafood Restaurant.

### Day 2: Cultural Immersion & Wildlife Adventure
**Morning (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM)**
• **Mari Mari Cultural Village** - Step back in time and experience the rich heritage of Sabah's indigenous tribes. Learn about traditional customs, try blowpipe shooting, fire-starting, and enjoy cultural performances. It's an interactive and educational experience for all ages.
• **Local Craft Shopping** - Browse the souvenir shop for authentic handicrafts and unique gifts to remember your trip.

**Afternoon (1:00 PM - 5:00 PM)**
• **Travel to Klias Wetlands** - Embark on a scenic journey south of Kota Kinabalu to the Klias Wetlands, known for its incredible biodiversity.
• **River Cruise for Proboscis Monkeys** - Take a relaxing river cruise along the Klias River, keeping an eye out for the unique proboscis monkeys (endemic to Borneo) and other wildlife like macaques, monitor lizards, and various bird species.

**Evening (6:00 PM - 9:00 PM)**
• **Traditional Dinner** - Enjoy a simple but delicious local dinner as part of your Klias tour package.
• **Firefly Spectacle** - As dusk settles, embark on another magical river cruise to witness thousands of twinkling fireflies lighting up the mangrove trees, creating a truly enchanting experience.

### Day 3: City Exploration & Departure
**Morning (9:00 AM - 12:00 PM)**
• **Gaya Street Sunday Market (if applicable)** - If your Day 3 falls on a Sunday, immerse yourselves in the vibrant Gaya Street Sunday Market. Find local crafts, street food, souvenirs, and live performances.
• **Sabah Museum** - If it's not Sunday or you prefer history, visit the Sabah Museum to learn more about the state's history, culture, and natural heritage. The adjacent Heritage Village is also interesting.
• **Filipino Market (Handicraft Market)** - Explore this bustling market for souvenirs, pearls, and local crafts. Remember to bargain!

**Afternoon (1:00 PM - 5:00 PM)**
• **Lunch at a Local Eatery** - Savor some authentic Sabahan delicacies like Laksa, Tuaran Mee, or Ngiu Chap (beef noodle soup).
• **Jesselton Point Waterfront** - Enjoy a leisurely stroll along the waterfront, take some photos, and perhaps grab a refreshing drink.
• **Last-minute Shopping** - Pick up any final souvenirs or local snacks from shopping malls like Suria Sabah or Imago Shopping Mall.

**Evening (6:00 PM - 9:00 PM)**
• **Farewell Dinner** - Enjoy a final delicious meal, perhaps trying another local favorite or revisiting a place you loved.
• **Transfer to Airport** - Head to Kota Kinabalu International Airport (BKI) for your departure.

### 🏨 Accommodation Recommendations (for 5 people)
• **Budget Option**: **Kinabalu Daya Hotel** - RM200-RM350/night for family rooms - Centrally located, clean, and comfortable, good value.
• **Mid-range Option**: **Mercure Kota Kinabalu City Centre** - RM350-RM600/night for connecting rooms/suites - Modern hotel with good facilities, often has family-friendly amenities, good location.
• **Luxury Option**: **Shangri-La Rasa Ria, Kota Kinabalu (Beach Wing)** - RM800-RM1500+/night for family suites/connecting rooms - A resort experience with a private beach, kids' club, and an orangutan rehabilitation center (within the resort's nature reserve), though it's a bit further from the city center (45-60 min drive).
• **Luxury Option (City)**: **Hyatt Regency Kinabalu** - RM700-RM1200+/night for connecting rooms/suites - Excellent city-center location, luxurious comfort, and great dining options.

### 🍽️ Must-Try Local Food
• **Seafood** - Everywhere! Head to Welcome Seafood Restaurant, Gayang Seafood Restaurant (further out), or Salut Seafood Restaurant for fresh catches prepared in various styles.
• **Laksa Sabah** - A rich, flavorful curry noodle soup. Try it at Yee Fung Laksa or Fook Yuen Cafe & Bakery.
• **Ngiu Chap (Beef Noodle Soup)** - A hearty soup with various beef cuts and noodles. Kah Hiong Ngiu Chap is a local favorite.
• **Tuaran Mee** - Springy egg noodles stir-fried with char siu (BBQ pork) and egg. Look for it at local coffee shops.
• **Kuih Cincin** - A traditional crunchy, ring-shaped cookie, great for snacks or souvenirs.
• **Fresh Tropical Fruits** - Durian (seasonal), Rambutan, Mangosteen, and more from local markets.

### 💰 Estimated Budget (for 3 adults, 2 kids for 3 days = 5 people)
Your RM7000 budget for 3 days is quite generous and allows for a comfortable to luxurious trip.
• **Budget traveler**: RM 1200-1500 per day (RM3600-RM4500 total) - Staying in budget hotels, eating at local hawker stalls, using public transport/Grab.
• **Mid-range traveler**: RM 1800-2500 per day (RM5400-RM7500 total) - Comfortable hotels, mix of local and mid-range restaurants, private tours/Grab.
• **Luxury traveler**: RM 2500-4000+ per day (RM7500-RM12000+ total) - High-end resorts, fine dining, private transfers, exclusive experiences.

Given your RM7000 budget, you can comfortably enjoy a **mid-range to slightly luxury experience** for your family, including good accommodation, delicious food, and memorable tours.

### 📝 Important Tips
• **Stay Hydrated**: Sabah can be hot and humid. Drink plenty of water, especially during outdoor activities.
• **Sun Protection**: Bring sunscreen, hats, and sunglasses.
• **Insect Repellent**: Essential for jungle treks and evening river cruises (e.g., Klias Wetlands).
• **Cash**: While credit cards are accepted in many places, it's good to have small denominations of Malaysian Ringgit (RM) for markets, small stalls, and tips.
• **Book in Advance**: For popular tours (like island hopping, Klias fireflies, Mari Mari Cultural Village), especially during peak season, it's wise to book ahead.
• **Family-Friendly Apps**: Download Grab (for ride-hailing) and a good offline map app.
• **Respect Local Culture**: Dress modestly when visiting religious sites and always ask for permission before taking photos of people.
